Well, yeah. I always have. They hold each other’s gaze for a long moment. Then --
Can I tell you a secret...? Nikki gives him an expectant look over her beer as she ta a swig. He musters his courage...
I think Mackey’s the Cape Ann Killer. Nikki nearly spits out her beer. Davey’s words seem to ju hang there in the air between them. Then Nikki CHUCKLES.
I’m not kidding.
Mr. Mackey? Davey, he’s friends with my dad. He’s totally harmless.
That’s what he wants you to think.
I know how your mind works. But you’re wrong.
This is different. We’ve been spying on him and --
He’s a cop! If your mom and dad found out you’re spying on him, they would flip their shit.
I know. That’s why they’re not gonna. Not until we have real evidence to show them.
Davey, listen to me. You gotta stop.  50.
You’re just like everyone else...
No, look -- If you’re wrong, you'll look like a lunatic and be in trouble forever. And if you’re right... he might catch you, or come after you.
I’m not gonna get caught.
Please, just let the police handle the killer. I don’t want anything bad to happen to you... You might just be the only person left in this neighborhood I actually care about.
The guys look through a few brand new porn mags, all addressed to Mackey. This is Heaven.
It’s the freakin mother lode.
Staking out Mackey was the best idea you've ever had, Davey.
Had a pretty good idea, myself -- Farraday pulls out a BOTTLE OF JACK DANIELS.
Snagged it from my dad’s stash.
So you’re using those brainpowers for good. About damn time. Gimme some -- They eagerly pass the bottle around and take swigs. One b one, they cringe in disgust and GROAN. Farraday COUGHS --
Oh, it’s bad. It’s so bad.
Tastes like my mouth is bleeding.
Guess you dickheads aren’t men yet.  51. Eats keeps the Jack, clearly forcing it down with each ti sip as the other guys spit and swish sodas like mouthwash
So let’s hear it, what's up with you and Nikki?
We hung out again last night. She says she likes talking to me. We have, like, a connection.
Fuck you, a “connection.” Only connection I want with her is vaginal. Oral if she’s into it --
Don’t talk about her like that! The guys all blankly stare at him -- Who are you? Davey refocuses on Mackey’s house, miffed.
Ya think she douches?
Eww, Jesus, Woody!
What? My mom does --
Guys, we need to stay focused. Mackey’s still out there. We need something solid. Davey grabs the binoculars -- BINOCULARS POV: Davey scans the neighborhood, panning fro left to right...
We’ve been on him for weeks. If he was gonna give us a clue, we’d have seen it by now, don’t ya think? lands on THE HOFFMANS’ HOUSE. Lowers the binoculars.
Not if we missed it the first time. Grab the flashlight.  52.

The guys approach the front door. Everything dark inside. Davey shines his DURABEAM FLASHLIGHT through the windows can't make out anything. He tries the doorknob -- ERRRRRK -- AND IT OPENS! The front door slowly sways wide revealing a pitch black house. Davey’s eyes light up.
What. Everyone keeps their door unlocked around here.
Yeah, but this was locked last time... We gotta go in. What if they're dead in there?
You said the killer kills kids, not adults.
That’s not totally true. One of the articles at the library said he killed a whole family in Rockport. Police said something must've gone wrong. And if it's Mackey...
Fuck! That! You wanna go in there, be my guest. Dumbasses first. But Davey’s already on his way inside...
Davey, I was kidding! .... Davey! As they hesitantly follow Davey inside --
Guys, I got a bad feeling.
Farraday and Woody hang onto each other as the guys creep into the dark front room. Davey, flashlight leading the w finds the closest light switch. Flips it: nothing.
Light’s not working.
You guys smell that?  53.
Yeah. Smells like... roadkill.

If it's a bunch of dead bodies, I'm totally gonna shit my Calvin Kleins. Davey redirects the flashlight toward the room revealing THE PLACE IS A MESS. An overturned chair in the living ro two open trash bags in the kitchen, flies swarming -- A C eating among the refuse; mail and other debris on the flo throughout. It looks like some shit went down!
Still think I'm crazy? BRRRING -- The HOME TELEPHONE RINGS, scaring the hell out the boys.
Goddamit!

Farraday, check your Calvins. AS THE PHONE CONTINUES TO RING, Davey pushes ahead, movin through the dark, nervous as hell, the boys huddled behin him. Step by painstaking step... Davey aims the flashlight into the kitchen.
Woody, try the kitchen light. It's around the corner.
Me!? Why me!?

Just do it! I'll shine the light. Woody falters, but forces himself toward the now-illumina kitchen doorway, rounds it -- AND BUMPS INTO SOMEONE STANDING THERE HOLDING A KNIFE! Wo falls backward onto the floor --
THE FIGURE FLIPS ON THE KITCHEN LIGHT revealing -- IT’S NIKKI. And it’s not a knife she’s got, it’s a SCREWDRIVER. Thank Christ...
What the fuck, fuckers! Nearly had a goddamn heart attack.
You guys scared the shit outta me!
We scared you!?
What are you even doing here? With the lights off?
A fuse blew while I was vacuuming this mess. Stupid cats.
Why’re you cleaning up after the Hoffmans’ cats? And where’re the Hoffmans?
They're at the lakehouse for the summer. They pay me to make sure Barnaby and Trixy don’t die. Easy money. Usually... The guys share a look of relief tinged with disappointmen
Wanna explain what the hell you guys are doing in here?
Sammy’s been missing so we thought maybe... the Hoffmans were dead.
And that it might’ve been Mackey...? Seriously...? Nikki CHUCKLES. Davey looks away, embarrassed.
You told her? Okay, what is going on with you two? You hookin up?  55. Davey gives him a piercing, horrified look. But Nikki smi totally seeing what’s going on. She switches on the sexy.

Let’s just say he’s more of a man than you jerkoffs. She winks at Davey and heads off into the kitchen. Davey’s eyes couldn’t be wider. He’s in shock. The other LAUGH and HOLLER, proudly clapping him on the back.
Holy fucking shit. You’re my God. JUST INSIDE THE KITCHEN, Nikki smiles wide, hearing it al INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - DAY Davey crashes into his room with a basket full of clothes
and don’t forget to clean your room! I mean it --

I know, Mom. God... Knocks a FRAMED PHOTO off of his nightstand. Picks it up It’s a PHOTO of DAVEY (10) WITH HIS YOUNGER MOM AND DAD. places it back on the nightstand as he dumps the clothes his bed. Looks around the room at the MESS. Ugh... He opens his disaster of a closet, jams more junk inside. he's about to close it, his eyes fall on -- TWO WORN GAMBLES G.I. JOE WALKIE-TALKIES atop a crate of toys. Davey’s wheels start spinning. He grabs his regular

Guys, what time’re we playing Manhunt tonight? I’ve got an idea... EXT. MACKEY’S YARD - NIGHT Dressed in black, the guys sprint through backyards, unde porches, over driveways, converging in the bushes along Mackey’s house. They’re all out of breath, but exhilarate
Arright, here’s the plan -- Davey pulls out the pair of old school G.I. Joe walkies.  56.
Holy shit, you still have those?
While you guys are spying, I’m gonna plant one of these outside Mackey’s window. Use the other one to listen.
Audio surveillance. Smart.
Let’s just not get caught, okay?

Mackey spots you, act like it’s part of the game. We probably got five minutes til those little shits are up our asses with flashlights, so let’s be quick. Farraday, Woody, you guys take ground level. Me and Eats are up top. Operation Manhunt starts now. They break. Eats follows Farraday. Woody follows Davey... -- Farraday runs into the bushes along the driveway. His pops up to LOOK INTO THE KITCHEN WINDOW as -- -- Eats climbs a tree to get eyes on the UPSTAIRS BATHROO Looks down at Farraday. Thumbs up. Then flips him off. -- Woody sneaks along the house to THE DINING ROOM WINDOW Where Davey saw the missing boy weeks ago. Looks up at -- -- Davey scales the tree at the front corner of the house over the driveway. Finds a VIEW INTO MACKEY’S BEDROOM. Gazing into the window, Davey makes sure Mackey’s not the Whips out the G.I. Joe walkie, some duct tape. Wraps the around the walkie SO THAT THE TRANSMIT BUTTON IS PERMANEN PRESSED DOWN (i.e. ALWAYS LISTENING). Davey slides himself out along a thick branch that reache toward the bedroom window. Manages to PLACE IT ON THE WINDOWSILL just outside the bedroom. CLICKS IT ON --
Found ya, ya big, bearded ball sack! A BRIGHT LIGHT suddenly nails Woody below. He holds a han his eyes, looks into TOMMY WARRENS’ (9) flashlight.
Fuck off, Tommy! We got time out!  57.
No, ya don’t -- I caught you!
Want me to beat the shit outta ya? Cuz I will, ya little -- AHHH! Tommy runs off into the night, terrified. Just then

I got eyes on him! IN THE TREE AROUND THE HOUSE, Eats hugs the branches to h as THROUGH THE WINDOW, he sees -- MACKEY, YELLOW RUBBER GLOVES on both hands. He gathers CLEANING SUPPLIES into a BUCKET. He seems perturbed.
He’s wearing rubber gloves! And he’s got a bucket of cleaning shit.
Like, stuff to clean up blood? Mackey heads out of the bathroom with his cleaning kit.
Guys, I lost him. He’s on the move. IN THE BUSHES BELOW, Farraday sees Mackey enter the kitch
Got him! He just came downstairs.
What’s in the bucket?
Looks like bleach. And a scrubbing brush. Can’t tell what the rest is. What the...? Farraday spots a RED STAIN on Mackey’s shirt
Blood! He’s got blood on him!
Holy crap -- Are you sure?

Well, maybe it’s paint? I don’t know. It’s on his shirt -- Oh shit!  58. FARRADAY DROPS into the bushes as MACKEY WALKS RIGHT PAST window. When Farraday sneaks a peek again... MACKEY’S GON ON THE DRIVEWAY SIDE, Mackey comes into Woody’s view --
I got him! Woody watches, face as close to the glass as he can get without fogging it up as Mackey pauses at the BASEMENT DO Checks his bucket. Pissed, he rushes down the steps...
He went into the basement! Woody bolts to the nearest basement window. Crouches down look in but IT’S BLACKED OUT. PAINTED ON THE INSIDE. He rushes to the next window. Same. Next window... Same. Shi

Mackey’s M.I.A. All his basement windows are painted over. DAVEY DROPS TO THE GROUND, looks up at the bedroom window THE WALKIE IS HIDDEN by the sill except the tip of the antenna. No way you’d see it. Unless you were looking for Satisfied, Davey sneaks up to the nearest window. Raises himself up to look inside just as -- MACKEY POPS INTO THE WINDOW! Slides it open to get fresh not noticing Davey, until -- DAVEY PANICS! SCREAMS, sprints away, Woody right behind h From the far side of the house, Eats and Farraday sprint from the shadows following Davey and Woody. Mackey stares out at them, concerned... INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT In bed but wide awake, Davey has the other G.I. JOE WALKI his chest. He shakes it a few times, but nothing changes. Total radio silence. He grabs his binoculars, looks out a BINOCULARS POV: Mackey's house. The tree beside it blocks Davey’s view of the G.I. Joe walkie on the bedroom windowsill. Damn.
The G.I. Joe walkie’s not working.  59. He looks back at Woody who's lounging on the floor in his sleeping bag, reading a comic by flashlight.
Did ya test em first?
Yeah, the batteries are brand new.
No, the distance. Remember? Those things were junk, that’s why we upgraded. They couldn’t transmit far.
Shit -- I forgot. Woody hops up onto Davey's bed, grabs the binoculars and gazes out toward Mackey's house.
So what’re ya gonna do? Just say frig it and leave it up there?
No way. Who knows what we could find out. I gotta make it work.

Davey wheels down the sidewalk on his bike, chucking newspapers onto porches. As he reaches Mackey’s driveway, slows to a stop. Waits -- No movement inside the house. Coast seemingly clear, Davey drops his bike and newspaper bag, hurries up the driveway... At the side of the house, he reaches down and SWITCHES ON G.I. JOE WALKIE clipped to his belt. NOTHING TRANSMITTING He goes to the tree below the window, gets ready to climb when he looks in the backyard and sees -- MACKEY, covered in sweat, dumping a big bag of dirt OVER HUMAN-SIZED MOUND IN THE GARDEN. Davey freezes in disbelief as MACKEY LOOKS UP, SPOTS HIM
Yo, Davey! Davey strains to keep himself from bolting as Mackey clap dirt off his hands, walks up to the fence. Leans on it.  60.
Hey, bud -- Gotta tell ya, you scared the shit outta me last night. Had no idea you were in my bushes. Great hiding spot.
Yeah. Your yard’s full of em.
Guess you didn’t see me coming either, huh? One hell of a scream. Mackey LAUGHS. Davey fakes it. Fuckfuckfuckfuckfuck...
So what’s up? Oh -- Lemme guess, I owe you money?
Uh, yeah.

Right. This time I’m ready for ya. He pulls a $5 bill from his wallet. Holds it out to Davey Davey reluctantly walks toward him. AS HE NEARS THE HOUSE SCREECH! A HIGH-PITCHED SHRIEK fills the air -- WALKIE-TA FEEDBACK! Horrified, Davey scrambles to turn off the screaming walkie on his belt. Finds the POWER SWITCH. Fli it off. Immediately, the FEEDBACK STOPS.
Sorry. Must’ve left it on. From the game last night.
Mind if I have a look at it? Davey cautiously hands the walkie over. Mackey gives it a quick once over. Hands it back.
You know, if you ever want some real walkies, I have a few retired ones from the force just collecting dust inside. Why don't ya come in and I'll show ya. They pick up everything --

I can't. Right now. Gotta get back to my route. But thanks for the payment.  61. Davey swipes the $5 bill from Mackey’s hand. Hurries back his bike. As he loads up and pedals off, he looks back. Mackey hasn’t moved. Gives Davey a parting wave. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Davey tries to read his Hardy Boys book, but it’s impossi He grabs the G.I. JOE WALKIE, paces with it, glaring at t object that nearly got him caught. Unable to resist the u anymore, he grabs his binoculars -- BINOCULARS POV: Mackey’s house. The tree outside Mackey’s bedroom window is still blocking the view of the sill. Da PANS ACROSS the house. Finally lands on --
Davey dives out of sight, heart in his throat, shaking --

Shitshitshitshit... Cautiously, he picks up the binoculars again, kneels at t window. Gathering his courage, he looks out to find -- BINOCULARS POV: MACKEY’S GONE! And then Davey sees it -- THE INSIDE SILL OF THE WINDOW WHERE MACKEY JUST STOOD...

text: He knows! Davey lowers the binoculars, hands shaking, fac frozen in horror -- DEEP BREATH... DEEP BREATH... What the fuck do I do!? Davey paces. Grabs his walkie --

Guys! Guys! You copy? .... Come in! (radio silence) I’m freaking out! Woody, you there!? Dead air. Davey chucks the walkie onto his bed. His eyes canvas the room with purpose, landing on -- THE LOUISVILLE SLUGGER BASEBALL BAT leaning in the corner grabs it. Pulls a chair to the window. Loops the binocula around his neck and props himself up on his elbows to kee overnight watch on Mackey's house. EYES WIDE, vigilant -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - MORNING BLINK... BLINK... Davey wakes. Still in the chair, still holding the baseball bat. Realizes it's morning. Jolts up Wipes his eyes quickly, scanning the room. He’s alive.  62. Purpose in his eyes, he checks his watch: 9:33am. Bolts t his nightstand, grabs his walkie. Pulls his notebook out the top drawer. Flips through pages until he lands on -- “MACKEY'’S DAILY SCHEDULE” Eyes pouring over the details, Davey hones in on one line -- “11PM: GOES FOR A JOG.”
Guys, we gotta talk. Treehouse in twenty.

MACKEY. Dressed in Larry Bird short-shorts, high socks, sweatshirt and headband. Jogging, breathing hard. His fac coming in and out of shadow as streetlights pass by above He’s all alone, king of the abandoned late night streets.
The friggin walkie was sitting in his window. He wanted me to see it.
Oh my god. He's onto us. I should've listened to my parents.
Your parents? Who listens to their parents?

There's no way he knows why we're spying on him, but even if he does, he's not onto you, he's onto me. Which is why I need you guys now more than ever. As Mackey keeps jogging, in the distance behind him, TWO FIGURES on BMX BIKES pop out from behind bushes. Follow safely behind Mackey, sticking to the shadows.

Mackey goes for a jog every night at eleven. Farraday and Woody, you’re gonna follow him tonight. Farraday and Woody duck behind trees and lampposts for co Keeping as quiet as possible as they track their quarry..
Where are you and Eats gonna be?  63.
The guys are all in front of the whiteboard. A military strategy session led by --
Yesterday on my route, I saw Mackey dumping dirt over something in his garden. Something the size of a body.
I don’t like where this is going... EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Davey and Eats rush up the driveway dressed in all black. SHOVELS in hand. Barely visible under the moonlight.
While you two follow Mackey, we’re gonna tear up his garden. See if we can find that body. Or bodies... They toss the shovels over the fence, vault it. Red rover red rover...
What if Mackey catches us?

Not gonna happen. If he starts heading back, Woody and Farraday will radio to let us know. Davey plants a HANDHELD CB RADIO in the dirt. Turns it on keeps the VOLUME LOW. He and Eats dig in with the shovels
The guys seem a little hesitant.
Okay, but what about the garden? He’s gonna notice it’s all dug up.
Raccoons. Just like with the garbage in the street. They’re trying to get food. What’s in a garden?
Food! Eats punches his shoulder. Idiot.  64.
We just wait for him to leave. Stay in touch with our CBs the whole time. It’s foolproof. Let’s pin the tail on this donkey. Off Davey’s grin, we --

Panting, the sweat-stained Mackey runs up to your typical outdoor self-storage facility. Rows and rows of units. He takes a key out of his sock, opens the wide metal roll door. Enters and lowers the door ALMOST TO THE GROUND... FROM AROUND THE CORNER, Farraday and Woody watch on, thei bikes on the ground. But from their perspective, they can see inside the storage unit.
We’ve gotta get closer.
How the hell’re we gonna do that without him seeing us? Woody turns back to find FARRADAY IS ALREADY GONE!

Farraday! Goddammit... SNEAKING ALONG THE UNITS, Woody catches up to Farraday wh moving as silently and quickly as possible. They finally get to the edge of Mackey’s unit, hearts pounding. Farraday looks at Woody. Puts a finger to his l Don’t make a sound! Woody snarls back: No shit! Farraday points to Woody’s eyes, then around the corner: a look. Woody angrily mouths, Why me? Farraday: DO IT! Annoyed and terrified, Woody leans down, peeks inside the unit. HE CAN ONLY SEE ALONG THE GROUND. The roll up gate blocking everything higher than a foot tall. ON THE FLOOR OF THE UNIT are a shitload of BAGS OF SOIL, or five SHOVELS, the PICKAX, and a stack of LARGE, STRIPE BAGS labeled “NaOH.”
(to himself) “Noah"...?  65. Next to the bags is A CAR, only its tires visible --
The guys jump back into the shadows as Mackey hops into h YELLOW VOLKSWAGEN BUG. The car engine PUTTERS to a start. Mackey PULLS THE CAR OUT OF THE UNIT. Hops back out, SING
“Every step you take... Every move you make...” Mackey closes the unit door after him. Locks it...
“Every word you say... Every game you play, I’ll be watching you...” jumps back into his VW Bug and ZIPS AWAY...
Was he talking to us?
What? No dude, that was The Police.
You heard the police!?
I pray for you sometimes... Farraday and Woody sprint back to their bikes. As they ra away, Farraday YELLS into his HANDHELD CB RADIO --

Guys, Mackey just got into a yellow Volkswagen Bug. We lost him. EXT. MACKEY’S BACKYARD - GARDEN - CONTINUOUS ON DAVEY’S CB RADIO, partially covered in dirt, VOLUME ST LOW. FARRADAY’S WORDS ARE BARELY AUDIBLE.
I repeat, we lost him. Do you copy? TEN FEET AWAY, the oblivious Davey and Eats are still excavating, soaked in sweat.
This is a lost cause. There’s nothing here.  66.
We're just not digging deep enough. Their heavy breathing fills the air...

You know Mackey had a shed back here? Davey turns. Sure enough, deep in Mackey’s backyard, naturally camouflaged by trees, IS A UTILITY SHED. EXT. MACKEY’S BACKYARD - UTILITY SHED - MOMENTS LATER Davey and Eats peek inside the windows with bulky Durabea flashlights, but the glare on the glass is blinding.
Can’t see anything. On the shed door is a PADLOCK. Davey jiggles it. IT’S LOC

I got this... Eats reaches into his pocket. Pulls out a keychain. On it a PAPERCLIP. He unbends the paperclip, sticks it into the padlock. Works it around skillfully for a moment -- CLICK -- The padlock releases. Eats nods arrogantly.
How the hell’d you do that?
I’m just good at working the hole. Eats removes the lock. Opens the door.
Dude, I’m serious.
Honestly, just jiggle it a bunch, work it around and it’1l pop open most of the time. Wicked easy.
The guys check every nook and cranny with their Durabeams tools, a lawn mower, a work bench... Usual shed stuff.
Well this whole night's been a waste of time.  67. But something catches Davey’s eyes. In the corner. He shi his light on it... and his eyes go wide!
Until now. Davey reaches out, grabs a SHREDDED GREEN TEE SHIRT that’ fallen underneath a workbench. Recognize the LOGO on it?
It’s a shitty Atari shirt, so what?
So, this is Dusty Dewitt’s shirt!
Who...? .... Oh, the ginger. Davey looks over the shirt, sees --
This is blood!
Fuck, dude. Heinous --
Hey, what are you doing in here!? Davey and Eats nearly shit themselves as they spin to fin FARRADAY AND WOODY, laughing their balls off.
You two got a death wish!?
Us? What about you? We’ve been trying to call you on the CB for like twenty minutes.
Oh shit, we left it by the garden.
Mackey has a storage unit outside town. And he keeps a VW Bug in it. He drove off and we lost him --
We have no clue where he’s going.  68.

Then we better get the hell outta here. Check out what we found... As Davey shows the guys the bloodied Atari shirt, we -- INT. FARRADAY’S HOUSE - A SHORT TIME LATER Eats picks through Farraday’s refrigerator while the othe guys chow down on PB&J sandwiches.
Why’s he got all those bags of dirt in the storage unit?
Plus shovels and a pickax...?
Same reason he’s got Dusty Dewitt’s shirt. He killed him and buried the body somewhere. Davey tosses the bloody, shredded shirt onto the counter.
Dude...! My mom makes my mac n’ cheese right there... Farraday grabs a pair of TONGS out of a drawer, picks up nasty shirt and rests it atop the trash.
He also had a bunch of bags of... something. They had chemical warning signs on em, looked hazardous as hell. “Noah,” that’s what it said.
“Noah”? What the hell’s that?
How the hell should I know? But it was spelled kinda weird. Woody grabs a notepad and a pen. Jots down a few chemical symbols and writes “NoAH." Slides it over to Farraday --
Classic Woody. This look right? Farraday crosses out “NoAH.” Writes down, “NaOH.”  69.
Yeah. Same thing.
No, what you wrote means nothing. What I wrote is the chemical formula for Sodium Hydroxide.
Congrats, Woody -- You’re retarded.
Shove it, Eats.
What the hell’s sodium hydroxide?

I know it isn’t useful in gardening. Pretty sure it’d be toxic to plants. Davey hurries to the bookcase full of ENCYCLOPEDIA BRITANNICAs and scans them. Finds volume “Q-T.” Pulls it flips through rapidly -- IN THE BOOK, Davey’s finger traces down the page landing “SODIUM HYDROXIDE." His eyes grow wider.
Holy shit, you guys! As the guys gather around Davey, he reads aloud:

“Sodium Hydroxide breaks down the chemical bonds that keep flesh intact, turning organic tissue to liquid. It's frequently used to decompose roadkill dumped in landfills, as it prevents the growth of microorganisms, therefore neutralizing and immobilizing acidic components formed in the decomposition process. This will reduce the odor of decomposition.” Eats, Farraday and Woody listen in stunned silence.
This sicko’s using this stuff to cover up the smell from the dead bodies he’s dumping someplace! “Holy shit" looks all around.  70.

Got good news for ya, Woody. It’s time to tell my parents. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Out of breath, Davey and the guys unload on Davey’s visib distraught parents. Dusty Dewitt’s frozen face stares bac them from the EMPTY MILK CARTON that sits atop the coffee table beside the shredded BLOODSTAINED ATARI TEE SHIRT.
Mackey’s the Cape Ann Killer!
David Aaron Armstrong! Lower your voice. People outside might hear.
Mackey’s a cop for Chrissakes! He’s also been our neighbor since before you were born --
Every serial killer is somebody's neighbor, Dad --
Regardless, a milk carton, a tee shirt and a storage unit don’t prove a goddamn thing!
How could you all go along with this?
We didn’t want to, trust me.
We wouldn’t have if it didn’t make so much sense.
After we followed him to that storage unit and saw --
Jesus, you’ve been spying on him!?
We had to! And the more we watch, the more the details stack up. He goes jogging at eleven at night. He buys tons of dirt every week. (MORE )
He keeps a spare car in a storage unit. Why would he do that? There was nothing in his garden when we dug it up, but I’m positive that if --
You dug up his -- Goddammit, Davey! Randall can’t sit anymore. He gets up and paces. Nervous.
You are in deep, deep trouble! All of you! Vandalism, spying, stealing -- This is unacceptable!
We're trying to save people.
Worry about yourselves! We’re going over there right now and you’re going to apologize for all of this. Randall grabs the milk carton. Rams it against Davey’s ch
I’m putting an end to this nonsense right now. You better hope he doesn’t press charges.
Randall marches across the cul-de-sac, the boys following like dead men walking. WHISPERING to each other.
Fuck, Davey! You know how much shit we're all gonna be in now?
What’re we even gonna say to him?
He’s probably gonna kill us --

Shut up! Davey inconspicuously tucks the bloody shirt into his bac pocket as they reach --  72. EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - FRONT DOOR - CONTINUOUS Randall RINGS THE BELL. The guys all cower behind him as DOOR OPENS. Mackey freezes.
Randall. Guys. What’s up?
Hey, Wayne -- Uh, listen, the boys have something they need to tell you, and I wanna apologize in advance. Just know that Sheila and I are as outraged as you're about to be...

Jesus... Well I’m sure whatever it is, we can make things right. Randall and Mackey look back at Davey, waiting. Davey swe under the pressure of being this close to Mackey. He can’ find the words. Randall nudges him.
Uh, hey, Mr. Mackey -- We just wanted to say we’re sorry. We’re the ones who ripped up your garden. And your garbage.
Oh man, I just assumed it was raccoons. Why’d you do that? Davey hands Mackey the MILK CARTON. Mackey looks at it, confused. Randall shakes his head, embarrassed.
A few weeks ago, I thought I saw that boy in your house. We were playing Manhunt and I was hiding in your bushes and...
